subject: Investing
title: Core-Satellite Global Strategy
description: A fast breakdown of Core-Satellite Global Strategy for builders.

hook.text: 80% of the portfolio in boring index funds, 20% in targeted country bets. That's the core-satellite approach.

buildup.text: The core holds broad, low-cost global index funds for stable, diversified exposure to world markets.

discovery.text: Satellites are smaller, targeted bets on regions or themes you have conviction aboutâ€”India growth, EM value, etc.

twist.text: If your satellites underperform, the core protects you. If they outperform, you capture meaningful alpha.

climax.text: Keep satellite positions at 5-10% each and review quarterly. Kill the thesis if the facts change.

punchline.text: The core keeps you safe. The satellites keep it interesting. Both have a role.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'core' in a core-satellite strategy?
options: To provide stable, diversified global exposure through index funds
